text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Prime Minister Vo Van Kiet was given a red carpet welcome in Warsaw on Tuesday by Polish Prime Minister at the beginning of his two-day official visit.
-- Deputy Prime Minister Phan Van Khai said Vietnam must establish controls on the growing amount of money borrowed from foreign banks and governments.
-- The area of summer-autumn paddy in the southern Mekong Delta has decreased at least by 19,000 hectares compared with last year's level because of difficulties and delay of the previous crop.

-- The Planning and Investment Ministry released a list of 23 projects calling for investment under form of build-operate-transfer and offers of exemption of land rentals and import tax for foreign investors taking part in those projects.
-- Communist Party Secretary General Do Muoi leaves Hanoi on Thursday for an friendship visit to Myanmar.
-- Vietnamese embassy in Phnom Penh has sent a letter to Cambodian officials and U.N Human Right protection center accusing Khmer Rouge of the recent killing of 12 Vietnamese in Rattanakiri province.

-- Vietnam's National Assembly issued resolution calling the entire people and sodiers to bring into play their mastership, to heighten the spirit of self-reliance and to practise thrift to build the country.
-- More than 3,000 monks attended a ceremony in Ho Chi Minh City on Wednesday to mark Buddha's birthday.
